meanings.definition: Complaining in a feeble or petulant way.
meanings.sent1: The whiny child kept asking for more candy.
meanings.sent2: She always sounds so whiny when she doesn't get her way.
meanings.sent3: The whiny puppy barked at the door for attention.
meanings.sent4: Her whiny voice grated on my nerves like nails on a chalkboard.
meanings.sent5: The whiny tone of his voice made it hard to take him seriously.

meanings.definition: A person who complains persistently and in a peevish or irritating way.
meanings.sent1: The office whiny always finds something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a whiny, nobody likes constant complainers.
meanings.sent3: The whiny in the group always brings down the mood with complaints.
meanings.sent4: She's the queen of the whinies, always finding fault in everything.
meanings.sent5: The whiny at the party made everyone uncomfortable with their constant griping.
